title: The neural resource allocation problem when enhancing human bodies with extra robotic limbs
abstract: The development of extra fingers and arms is an exciting research area in robotics, humanâ€“machine interaction and wearable electronics. It is unclear, however, whether humans can adapt and learn to control extra limbs and integrate them into a new sensorimotor representation, without sacrificing their natural abilities. The authors review this topic and describe challenges in allocating neural resources for robotic body augmentation.
